Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Cup
Description: Small cup with a flattened base and a simple, extremely flaring thinned lip. The clay is typical of the Middle Kerma: Nile mud mixed with a chaff temper. The surface has been burnished, in other words rubbed with a hard tool to give it a shiny surface. It is red-orange with a black outer rim and interior surface, like the majority of Nubian ceramics.
